title: Improve bootstrap exception handling
description:
Replace single catch-all exception handler in scripts/bootstrap.py:343-344 with proper error handling:

**Specific exceptions to handle:**
- FileNotFoundError - spec file not found
- PermissionError - cannot read/write files
- OSError - disk full, directory issues
- json.JSONDecodeError - malformed spec (if JSON)
- UnicodeDecodeError - encoding issues

**Per-file error tracking:**
- Track which files succeeded/failed individually
- Don't continue if critical files fail (CLAUDE.md, overview.md)
- Allow graceful degradation for optional files

**Rollback on failure:**
- If bootstrap fails mid-way, clean up partial files
- Or provide clear message about partial state

**Files to modify:**
- scripts/bootstrap.py

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Each exception type gets specific, actionable error message
- Partial failures don't leave corrupted state
- User knows exactly what failed and why
notes: Implemented comprehensive exception handling: SpecFileError for file issues, FileConflictError for existing files, FileCreationError for write failures. Added per-file try/catch with specific messages for PermissionError, OSError (disk full, read-only), UnicodeDecodeError (with latin-1 fallback). Implemented _rollback_files() method that tracks created files/dirs and cleans up on failure. Task files have graceful degradation (warnings instead of abort).
decision_rationale: Created custom exception hierarchy for semantic error handling. Used tracking lists for rollback support. Kept task file creation non-critical since main files are more important.
